required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Temocillin vs Meropenem for the Targeted Treatment of Bacteraemia Resistant to Third Gen Cephalosporins
clinical_study.official_title: Randomised Controlled Trial of Temocillin vs Meropenem for the Targeted Treatment of Bacteraemia Due to Enterobacteriaceae Showing Resistance to Third Generation Cephalosporins

lead_sponsor.agency: Fundación Pública Andaluza para la gestión de la Investigación en Sevilla

collaborator.agency: Spanish Network for Research in Infectious Diseases

clinical_study.source: Fundación Pública Andaluza para la gestión de la Investigación en Sevilla

brief_summary.textblock:
A Phase 3, Multicenter, Randomised, Controlled, Open-Label Study to demonstrate noninferiority of temocillin (unauthorized investigational medicinal product IMP in Spain, but authorized in Belgium and UK) vs a carbapenem antibiotic (meropenem) in adults with bacteraemia due to third-generation cephalosporin-resistant Enterobacteriaceae.
The duration of treatment will be between 7 and 14 days. From the 5th day of intravenous treatment, the sequential oral treatment is permitted if the patient meets appropriate conditions.

detailed_description.textblock:
The objective of the trial is to demonstrate the non-inferiority of temocillin (2g each 8 hours, intravenous) to carbapenems (meropenem 1g each 8 hours, intravenous) in terms of efficacy and safety in the targeted treatment of bacteraemia due to Enterobacteriaceae resistant to third-generation cephalosporins, and therefore provide evidence for the use of temocillin in these infections.
The duration of treatment will be between 7 and 14 days. From the 5th day of intravenous treatment, the sequential oral treatment is permitted if the patient meets appropriate conditions.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with a "success" at the test of cure (TOC)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7-10 days after the last day of antibiotic therapy
primary_outcome.description: A success at the test of cure is the resolution of infection symptoms
Number of patients who are alive

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who do not need to stop or change the assigned drug
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7-14 days after the last day of antibiotic therapy
primary_outcome.description: Reasons for not change can be no adverse event, no perceived failure during treatment or no occurrence of a superimposed infection. Participants who stop or change the assigned drug will not meet the primary outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who do not need to prolong therapy beyond 14 days
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 7-14 days after the last day of antibiotic therapy
primary_outcome.description: Assigned treatment to be administered for less than 14 days
Recurrence is reappearance of symptoms with positive blood culture for the same microorganism. Participants with recurrence will not meet the primary outcome.

secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients dead up to day 28.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 28 days
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days patients has been in-hospital

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From day 1 of intravenous antibiotic treatment administration to last intravenous administration, average 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days patients has been under intravenous antibiotic treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of total administration of therapy (days)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From day 1 of intravenous or oral antibiotic treatment administration to last intravenous or oral administration, average 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: Number of days patients has been under intravenous or oral antibiotic treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v4.0
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v4.0

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with resistance development during therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Resistance development will be measured in a positive blood culture

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Sequential Organ failure (SOFA) score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At days 1, 3, end of treatment (days 7-14) and visit 4

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in Barthel Index for Activities of Daily Living (ADL) for patients older than 70 years old
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At days 1, 3, end of treatment (days 7-14) and visit 4
secondary_outcome.description: Barthel Index for Activities of Daily Living (ADL) score changes; score from 0, completely dependent patient to 100, completely independent for activities of daily living

other_outcome.time_frame: At 1hour, 4hours, 6hours and y 8hours from temocillin first infusion, on days 1 and 3
other_outcome.description: Exploratory objective in a reduced number of patients on which plasma levels of temocillin will be measured to determine maximum plasma levels of temocillin

other_outcome.time_frame: At 1hour, 4hours, 6hours and y 8hours from temocillin first infusion, on days 1 and 3
other_outcome.description: Exploratory objective in a reduced number of patients on which plasma levels of temocillin will be measured to determine minimum plasma levels of temocillin

other_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) of temocillin
other_outcome.time_frame: At 1hour, 4hours, 6hours and y 8hours from temocillin first infusion, on days 1 and 3
other_outcome.description: Exploratory objective in a reduced number of patients on which plasma levels of temocillin will be measured to determine area under curve of temocillin

arm_group.description: Patients enrolled in this arm, will receive 2g each 8 hours of intravenous temocillin.
Patients enrolled in this arm, will receive 1g each 8 hours of intravenous meropenem.

intervention.description: The intervention of experimental arm will be Intravenous administration of temocillin.
The intervention of comparator arm will be intravenous administration of meropenem.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients with monomicrobial bacteraemia due to Enterobacteriaceae showing resistance to cefotaxime, ceftriaxone (MIC >2 mg/L) and/or ceftazidime (MIC >4 mg/L), ands sensible to temocillin (MIC ≤8 mg/L) and meropenem (MIC ≤2 mg/L).
Exclusion Criteria:
- <18 years
- Pregnancy
- Breastfeeding
- Palliative care
- Allergy to betalactams
- Polymicrobial bacteraemia
- Meningitis
- Infections typically needing prolonged >14 days of therapy (e.g., endocarditis, prosthetic joint infection, vascular graft infection, empyema, chronic prostatitis)
- Severe neutropenia
- Shock
- Active empirical treatment> 96 hours after initial blood culture extraction

patient_data.ipd_description: Planning for the study will be shared with potential sites pertaining to Spanish Network for Research in Infectious Disease (REIPI)for participation. IPD is not foreseen out of this groups due to the specific characteristics of patients and sites to be candidates for study participation.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: From starting to three years of study completion planification
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Spanish Network for Research in Infectious Disease investigators
